intro: Lepidium kirilowii, commonly known as Kirilow's cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces small, rounded seeds. Lepidium kirilowii is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it survive in its harsh natural habitat.
